item.title: Remembering the Bonanza Hotel & Casino: A Short But Colorful Chapter on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Wild West Welcome to the Strip

The Las Vegas Strip wasnâ€™t always the mega-resort playground we know today. Back in 1967, it was a collection of motels, smaller casinos, and budding hotels striving for a slice of the action. Enter the Bonanza Hotel & Casino, a western-themed property that quickly became a footnote in Las Vegas history. Located at 3645 South Las Vegas Boulevard, nestled between the Three Coins and the Galaxy Motel (which often served as its overflow lodging), the Bonanza opened its doors on July 1, 1967, promising a taste of the Old West on the burgeoning Strip.
